title: How did the East Germans transition from Nazi fascists to become fervent communists? - Quora

response.answer_text: I hate to use internet slang here, but *facepalm*. I used asterisks there. That indicates that I’m making the motion. Indicating that I am slapping my face with my palm. You can’t speak of people as a unified entity. This firstly assumes that everybody in the east of Germany was a fervent Nazi. Untrue. This also assumes that they just jumped over to being happy communists. Also untrue. What would become the German Democratic Republic actually decreased in population over its existence. This isn’t because everybody was randomly dying off of capitalistic allergies. They defected. That’s why the Berlin Wall was built. That’s why there were orders to shoot to kill. That’s why Republikflucht was illegal. As in, “trying to leave” was illegal and would get you freakin’ killed. If everybody in the GDR was a fervent communist, would this even be a law? No. Nobody would be trying to leave. And they wouldn’t have had to build a wall in the first place, because nobody would be trying to leave if the entire population were fervent communists. Nobody would be digging tunnels, nobody would be launching inflatable rafts into the sea, nobody would be building hackneyed hot air balloons, nobody would be hiding in prefabricated gasoline tanks and nobody would be disguising themselves as seats in a sedan if they were fervent communists and really wanted the GDR to be a thing and wanted to live in it. This question is false on its premises. Face. And. Palm.

To make the transition easier, the Soviets continued to use the former concentration camps existing in their zone, which were all too well known. So out came communist comrades, who happened to be part of the resistance to the Nazis, and would support the new powers. In came some “Nazis” (including 14 yr. old boys, who had been pressed into military service during the last month of the war, but excluding those guys, who had collected knowledge in the Gestapo, Secret State Police of the National Socialists, which would be of value to build up the Stasi, State Security Service of the Socialists). And all those people, who had another idea of the new Germany then Stalin. Or made some other faults. Same procedure then before. Well, some of the letter (like Social Democrats or clergymen) where already in and have just been kept there out of convenience. Sorry for the cynicism - question like this with obviously no clue of totalitarian systems (no matter if brown or red) just leads me to that…. And here the Wiki-source to get more info: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NKVD_special_camps_in_Germany_1945–49

They didn’t. They transitioned from doing as they were told to doing as they were told (which is actually pretty close to what the West Germans did for the first 20 years as well). That only changed with the German generations already born into the new systems. Both in the east and the west you had huge changes in the 60s, among other reasons because the new generations were now of the system and no longer people thrown into a new system but still rooted in older ones.

Quite apart from what the other answerers correctly point out, nazi or communist is entirely missing the point.The dividing line is not some fascism or communism or what-ever-ism, they really are totally irrelevant. Just labels for the same old. The big important parameter in politics and human societies is authoritarianism.Whether people as individuals and societies as a whole follow the dictate of a leading figure or group, or whether they are self determined. (Please avoid the word ‘free’, I always have to laugh- or cry- when Americans claim they are free.) Or as Richard K. Morgan put it: The question is whether the power is flowing up, to the leaders, or down, to the people. Power is never static. And with this all-important point in mind, we suddenly see that fascism and soviet style communism are very much on the same side of the ledger: Highly authoritarian systems.Transitioning from one label to the other is a piece of cake for a society that is used to obey. Further: believing in authority has been marked as the one overwhelming factor in voting for Mr. ‘Grab them by the pussy’ or not. Guess which way this goes?

As in today's societies you kinda go along with the flow. So most of the real nazis and the real socialist were hated by the common German citizen. In respect to that the transition was not that hard, and I think that it was more pleaura to go from National socialism to socialism.

They didn't. They weren't all fascists one day and communists the next. They weren't all fascists or communists at all. And, as a point of fact, more than a few of them remained or became fascist despite living in a “communist” country. There was a massive amount of trouble throughout the former eastern bloc with fascism after the end of the Warsaw Pact that continues even to this day.

Nazism and communism is quite close to each other. Both are based on categorisation and discrimination of humans. Both call their follower to submitt to a leader and join an almighty organisation. The transit was not only done in DDR. In Sweden, my grandpa was a devoted socialdemocrate. One of his colleges was an organized nazist. He told my grandpa that: When the Germans come. We will get you. So nazi occupation of Sweden would mean a one way ticket to a concentration camp for my grandpa. In 1942 the nazi-college joined the Swedish communist party.

Eric Hoffer’s key observation in The True Believer was that the details of the ideological programs of different mass movements actually make very little difference; that’s not why people join up and become such fanatic True Believers. They do so because they are nobodies, failures in life, desperate and in despair - and then along comes this thing that is bigger than themselves, offers them belonging and self-importance and meaning and hope. Changing from a Nazi into a Communist is just about as easy for these people as is switching your brand of beer.
Communism is fascist;  Communist are Fascists.
